elements.text:
Can someone please help me implement the following HMM and do parameter estimation using HMMBase

I have K = 8 latent states and two time points. My y at a time point t is similar to this matrix:

text: I'd be surprised if anyone was going to do this _for_ you. What have you done so far?

elements.text: I'd be surprised if anyone was going to do this
you. What have you done so far?

text:
```hmm = HMM(randtransmat(8), [Product(Beta.(rand(2))), 
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))), 
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2)))])```
`z,y=rand(hmm,10,seq=true)`

``` hmm, hist = fit_mle(hmm, y, display = :iter, init = :kmeans)```
The reason I didn’t share my code is because I know there is some problem with my logic and I was having a hard time visualizing how to feed my data at two time points to the HMM.

elements.text:
hmm = HMM(randtransmat(8), [Product(Beta.(rand(2))), 
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))),
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2))), 
                            Product(Beta.(rand(2)))])
hmm, hist = fit_mle(hmm, y, display = :iter, init = :kmeans)
The reason I didn’t share my code is because I know there is some problem with my logic and I was having a hard time visualizing how to feed my data at two time points to the HMM.
